author: MSNBC.com
title: Coronavirus outbreak forces Vatican to change holy week traditions
description: Matt Bradley reports from the Vatican on how Pope Francis and other officiants are celebrating Palm Sunday without the usual crowded masses.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Cuomo announces coronavirus deaths in New York dropping for the first time
description: During a press conference, NY Gov. Andrew Cuomo announces that the coronavirus death toll in New York has dropped "for the first time," but the significance is still unknown.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Congressmen from WA, CA call for ramped-up coronavirus testing
description: Coronavirus testing will be critical to bringing the pandemic under control congressman from the highly-impacted states of Washington and California tell Joy Reid. How can the Trump administration use it's authority to increase the production of test kits
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Biden suggests Democrats may have to hold a 'virtual convention'
description: Joe Biden says he thinks the Democrats may have to hold "a virtual convention" this summer amid the coronavirus pandemic
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Sen. Tina Smith: Trump is treating pandemic like PR war
description: Coronavirus pandemic responses of Donald Trump and members of the Trump administration are critiqued by Sen. Tina Smith (D-MN), who tells Joy Reid, 'If this is a public health war, we need a general, and what we have in Donald Trump is a pretender.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Rev. William Barber: 'This pandemic spreads through the fissures of our society'
description: Co-chair of the Poor People’s Campaign Rev. William Barber, law professor Dorothy Roberts and activist Sally Kohn offer solutions to the soaring poverty caused by coronavirus.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fmr. EPA administrator: Climate change risks our health when we can least afford it
description: Former EPA administrator and NRDC president Gina McCarthy on why Trump’s rollback of emissions regulations is especially dangerous during the pandemic.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fmr. Italian prime minister: 'Coronavirus is not simply a virus, it's a change of era'
description: Former Italian prime minister and Florence senator Matteo Renzi describes how his country is gradually recovering from one of the world’s worst outbreaks of COVID-19.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: As Surgeon General warns of 'Pearl Harbor moment', U.S. surpasses 9,000 COVID-19 deaths
description: As the US surpasses 9,000 COVID-19 deaths and more than 319,000 cases, Surgeon General Jerome Adams says that "the next week is going to be our Pearl Harbor moment, it’s going to be our 9/11 moment, it’s going to be the hardest moment for many Americans in th…

source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Trump's coronavirus press briefings criticized by media experts
description: The coronavirus pandemic responses of Donald Trump, NY Gov. Cuomo, and U.S. Surgeon General Jerome Adams are compared and contrasted by Joy Reid's panel.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Is press overly-praising Trump's pandemic response 'tone'?
description: Donald Trump's treatment by many in the daily press during the coronavirus pandemic is analyzed by MSNBC analyst and Vanity Fair reporter Gabe Sherman, who tells Joy Reid, 'They've surrounded him in a cocoon of normalcy that validates him as though this
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: NY Attorney General James on avoiding predators during pandemic
description: Coronavirus pandemic-linked price gouging is addressed by New York Attorney General Letitia James, who tells Joy Reid, 'I urge everyone to remain calm, and to listen to the facts.'
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Fmr VA Secy: People who are brave don't last very long in Washington these days
description: Both the Navy captain who raised concerns about coronavirus infections on his ship and the Inspector General of the intel community were recently removed from their positions. Watch as former Veterans Affairs Secretary David Shulkin reacts to the two high pro…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Health expert: We must reduce activity as pandemic peaks
description: The coronavirus pandemic response over the next two to three weeks could be crucial according to health experts, who urge Americans to limit their activities during this time. Ashish Jha, director of the Harvard Global Health Institute, joins Joy Reid to disc…
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: 'If we're out of sight, we're out mind': Navajo Nation express COVID-19 concerns
description: Vaughn Hillyard reports from Arizona about how COVID-19 is affecting the Navajo Nation, which has a higher infection rate than the rest of Arizona.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Nevada governor: ‘Lives are more important to us than the money’
description: Nevada governor Steve Sisolak joins Alex Witt to discuss his state's response to the COVID-19 pandemic and how his state is competing against larger states for supplies.
source.name: MSNBC

title: Philadelphia tourism battered by coronavirus, hotel and restaurant workers hit hard
description: The historic city of Philadelphia depends on tourism, hospitality and cultural attractions employing nearly 77,000 people. Hotels and restaurants are shut down and events are being canceled. NBC’s Maura Barrett reports on the hardest-hit industries and
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson admitted to hospital with persistent COVID-19 symptoms
description: British Prime Minister Boris Johnson has been admitted to a hospital as a precautionary measure following his lasting COVID-19 symptoms. Johnson tested positive for the virus over a week ago.
source.name: MSNBC

author: MSNBC.com
title: Around the country, Americans throw parties for couples who canceled weddings
description: With weddings being cancelled amidst the coronavirus pandemic, Joshua Jackson and Alex Witt highlight two parades thrown for newlywed couples - from a safe social distance.
source.name: MSNBC
